betterquesting.name: Leaf Puncher
betterquesting.desc: While your first instinct was to punch trees, you quickly realize this is a poor use of your time.  Breaking leaves on the other hand yields useful Sticks.

betterquesting.name: Your First Wood
betterquesting.desc:
A Flint Hatchet may not be much, but it allows you to chop Wood and offers basic protection.

Care should be taken when felling trees, as they will crash forcefully to the ground.  Hatchets will quickly mine through any remaining leaves.

§7Note: You can craft 3 gravel together to easily create flint.  Use JEI to find other recipes in this pack.§r

betterquesting.name: Tool Time
betterquesting.desc: Now that you can harvest Wood, it's time to make some real tools.  Craft the Tinkers Tool Stations to get started.

betterquesting.name: Rock Crackin'
betterquesting.desc: A basic set of tools can be crafted using Bone, Flint, or Cactus parts.  Using Blank Patterns in the Part Builder, construct at least a basic Pickaxe to start mining Stone.

betterquesting.name: Hemp Seeds
betterquesting.desc:
Hemp is a useful material that acts as an early source of String.  It's also the key to getting started with mechanical power.

Punch Tall Grass to start collecting Wheat and Hemp Seeds.  Craft a Mattock from any material, and use it to cultivate dirt into farmland.

Once grown, Hemp is best harvested at two blocks tall.

betterquesting.name: Mill Stone
betterquesting.desc:
Once you've farmed some hemp, you'll need to process it.

With a Hand Crank and Mill Stone, Raw Hemp can be ground into Hemp Fiber.  Place the Hand Crank directly on top of the Mill Stone and right click to use.

It will take about 5 rotations to finish.

betterquesting.name: Water Strainer
betterquesting.desc:
With no way to collect iron using your current pickaxe, perhaps a Water Strainer will yield small amounts of metal to melt down.

Place the Base one layer underwater, and the Strainer above it.  Small nuggets of iron and other resources may filter in while you tend to other tasks.

betterquesting.name: Smeltery
betterquesting.desc:
To melt down ores, you'll need to construct a Smeltery.

Place a Smeltery Controller, Tank, Drain, and Seared Bricks to form a complete structure.

betterquesting.name: Breaking the Mold
betterquesting.desc:
With no way of getting gold yet, Clay Molds will have to suffice.  They seem unable to withstand more than one use however.

Create a Stone Pickaxe Head in the part builder, and pour Molten Clay over it to create a mold.

betterquesting.name: Really Time to Mine
betterquesting.desc:
With both a source of iron and a way to cast it, you can finally create iron tools.  A pickaxe should be a top priority.  It will allow you to mine iron and gold ore blocks in the world.

An iron pickaxe head will require 18 iron nuggets total.

You might also start thinking about modifiers, such as adding redstone to improve mining speed.

betterquesting.name: The Furnace Returneth
betterquesting.desc:
One of the first things you'd like to make with iron is a good old Furnace.

While it's not advanced enough to smelt ores, it's perfect for cooking food and other items.

betterquesting.name: Better Molds
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you can mine gold, you can upgrade your smeltery molds to support multiple uses.  This should be helpful for future tool upgrades.

This will also allow you to create an ingot mold.  Molten gold poured on a seared brick should do the trick.

betterquesting.name: Tilting at Windmills
betterquesting.desc:
While the Hand Crank was effective for small jobs, some automation would make things much easier.  You believe you can construct a Windmill to automatically turn the Mill Stone, and maybe other machines too.

The Windmill will need to be placed high up, with Axles acting as carriers of the mechanical power.  Gearshafts can be used to make turns, or extend the length of axles past 3 blocks.

Windmills do not work well in a storm, and any attached gearboxes may be damaged as a result.  A Water Wheel may offer a more stable alternative in the future.

§7Note: Crouch+Right click will rotate gearboxes.§r

betterquesting.name: Hot Potato
betterquesting.desc:
You'll need a source of Lava to power your Smeltery.  A Clay Bucket should be strong enough to move lava, at least once.

It can be placed directly into the Smeltery's tank, shortly before disintegrating.

betterquesting.name: Toil and Trouble
betterquesting.desc:
Cauldrons offer you a way to tan leather, produce special crafting ingredients, and cook many foods for free.

To power the Cauldron you'll need to ignite a fire underneath it.  To keep the flame going however you will need an infinitely burning block, such as Netherrack or Charcoal.  Charcoal can be produced in a Charcoal pit, while Netherrack will require a trip to the Nether.  Either option will work for our purposes.

A Fire Charge or Flint and Steel can be used to light the initial fire.

In the future, this flame can be stoked to increase the utility of the crucible.

betterquesting.name: OSHA Compliance
betterquesting.desc: It's now possible to craft Iron Buckets that can move Lava without melting.  This will make moving lava in large quantities much easier.

betterquesting.name: Leather Scouring
betterquesting.desc: The first step to leatherworking is to scour the Leather in a Mill Stone.  This cleans it for the next step.

betterquesting.name: Totemic Magic
betterquesting.desc:
In a book, the Totempedia, you've read about mysterious powers that can be channeled through totem polls.  Intrigued by this claim, you've decided to try whittling your own totem using a Whittling Knife.

With a knife, you're able to carve various shapes into vertical logs.  Ensure a Totem Base sits at the bottom, and carve different animal shapes into the logs above it to discover their powers.

Remember that the Totempedia covers all you'll need to know.

betterquesting.name: Nerves of Steel
betterquesting.desc: Steel allows you to mine Cobalt and Ardite in The Nether, and unlocks access to a number of new machines.  It also opens the door to automation and ore doubling.

betterquesting.name: Goats in Boats
betterquesting.desc:
To move large numbers of animals, Boats can be tied together with a Lead to create a caravan.

Chest Boats can also be created for additional storage.

betterquesting.name: Making Music
betterquesting.desc:
A large part of the magic of totem polls seems to come from music.  Once a poll has been constructed nearby, different instruments can be played together to perform ceremonies.

Holding Sneak while playing an instrument allows you to play a Selected Note, which is how you specify which ceremony you'd like to perform.  Once started, you need to maintain enough Musical Melody before the timer runs out.  Complete the ceremony to activate its effect.

betterquesting.name: Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo
betterquesting.desc:
Buffalo are an important part of totemic magic, but they were lost long ago.  With no buffalo, it's not possible to acquire their hide or teeth for certain recipes.

However, ancient stories suggest that the Mandan Buffalo Dance ceremony may allow one to transmute modern day cows into buffalo.  Maybe it's worth a try?

betterquesting.name: Red Cedar
betterquesting.desc:
Red Cedar Trees are said to have magical properties.  This makes them an excellent wood to make totem polls out of.

The Zaphkiel Waltz is a ceremony that speeds up plant growth rates nearby for a short period, and also transforms any nearby saplings into Red Cedar Saplings.  At least, that's how the story goes.

Additional instruments such as the Jingle Dress and Rattle may be necessary to reach enough musical melody to perform this ceremony.

betterquesting.name: Ferrets, Peacocks, and More
betterquesting.desc:
Ferret
Peacock
Hamster
Hedgehog
Penguin

betterquesting.name: Taming Demons?
betterquesting.desc:
You've heard rumblings of Hell Hounds from the underworld, and may be daring enough to try to capture one.  A black bone dropped by wither skeletons may be just enough to temp one of these creatures.

They may not be as sophisticated as their overworld counterparts, but they sure know how to set things on fire.

betterquesting.name: Leather Tanning
betterquesting.desc:
Once cleaned up, the Leather needs to be tanned in a Cauldron.  Tree Bark will act as a tannin, and can be acquired by using an Iron Knife on a tree, or placing a log through the saw.

§7Note: This requires the "BetterWithMods" cauldron.§r

betterquesting.name: Saw
betterquesting.desc:
The Saw allows you to cut Wood Logs for additional Planks, and to trim off Bark.  Planks can be cut into Sidings or smaller components.  It's also rather dangerous to nearby entities, so point the sharp end away from yourself.

The saw can be powered from any side with mechnical energy, such as from a Windmill.

§7Information on crafting leather straps can be acquired under Farm Life.§r

betterquesting.name: Leather Cutting
betterquesting.desc:
Finally you can cut your tanned leather into finer strips.  This requires an iron knife, which is simple enough to craft with a flint sharpening stone.

Leather strips are useful for more refined leatherworking.  They're also a key ingredient in creating a saw.

betterquesting.name: Saddle Up
betterquesting.desc: With practiced leatherworking skills, you're able to create a suitable Saddle for horseback riding.

betterquesting.name: Filtered Hopper
betterquesting.desc:
By using the Saw to cut planks into sidings and corners, you're able to produce a Filtered Hopper.

Unlike the vanilla Hopper, the Filtered Hopper is able to sift resources through different types of filters.

betterquesting.name: The Nether
betterquesting.desc:
The Nether is fraught with new dangers, but it also grants you access to new resources and discoveries.

A Fire Charge or Flint and Steel can be used to light the portal.

§7§oIf you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.§r

betterquesting.name: Concentrated Hellfire
betterquesting.desc:
With some basic supplies from the nether and a Filtered Hopper, you're ready to make Concentrated Hellfire.

Place a piece of Soul Sand in the Filtered Hopper, and slowly drop in Ground Netherrack.  Eight Hellfire Dust can be turned into Concentrated Hellfire in a Cauldron or Smeltery.

Making sure the hopper is receiving mechanical power first is §ohighly§r recommended.

betterquesting.name: Hibachi
betterquesting.desc: The Hibachi is the upgrade to a Flint and Steel.  It will create a constant flame when given a redstone signal, and can be stoked with a Bellows to put out even higher temperatures.  This will be necessary for some future recipes.

betterquesting.name: Bellows
betterquesting.desc:
The Belows will act to stoke the fire from a Hibachi and increase its temperature.  This is noticable as a brilliant blue flame.

Belows must be powered by mechanical energy to function.  However, it will only compress while receiving power.  You must alternate between powered and unpowered to maintain a stoked flame.

The best way to do this is to provide a redstone signal to a Gearbox, which disables its operation.  A Redstone Clock can be used to time the circuit.

Apply a redstone signal to activate the Clock.  Toggling the Gearbox every two seconds or so should work nicely.

§7Note: Bellows will not function without an air gap above it.§r

betterquesting.name: Turntable
betterquesting.desc:
The Turntable will rotate blocks placed above it when powered with mechanical energy.  Clay blocks can be spun into various types of pottery, which will prove useful for further tech advances.

The four notches on the side indicate the various speeds the Turntable can spin at.  Mechanical energy must be input from the bottom.

betterquesting.name: Kiln
betterquesting.desc:
A kiln is a multiblock structure made up of Bricks.  An ideal shape is 3x3x2 vertically, with a gap in the middle to place your unfired item.

A stoked Hibachi needs to be placed underneath to maintain enough heat to fire your items.

betterquesting.name: Unfired Crucible
betterquesting.desc:
To create an Unfired Crucible, place a Clay block on an active Turntable and let it complete two rotations.  Each step will mold the pottery into smaller forms.

The available pottery are: Crucible, Planter, Vase, Urn, Mould.

Setting the Turntable to a slower speed may improve your precision.

betterquesting.name: Soul Urn
betterquesting.desc:
The Soul Urn is a crafting ingredient in Soulforged Steel.  It is created first by spinning Clay into an Urn, then firing it in a Kiln.

To turn it into a Soul Urn, place it directly under a Filtered Hopper and begin creating Hellfire Dust (Ground Netherrack with a Soul Sand filter).

betterquesting.name: Crusher
betterquesting.desc:
The Crusher is the key to ore duplication.  By grinding metals into smaller constituents, you're able to extract more yield from each ore.

The Crusher is a multiblock structure and must be assembled from the components listed to the right.  The Engineer's Manual will show you exactly how it's constructed.

betterquesting.name: Fired Crucible
betterquesting.desc:
The Crucible is used in the production of Soulforged Steel, as well as melting down various items.

It must be powered by a stoked Hibachi.  A single bellows can apply to multiple Hibachis, saving on resources.

betterquesting.name: Soulforged Steel
betterquesting.desc:
Soulforged Steel is the absolute top metal tier.  You can make some jolly good items with this, and a number of new powerful machines too.

Producing Soulforged Steel will require a stoked Crucible, a Soul Urn from the previous step, and Soul Flux.  Soul Flux can be produced by firing Endstone in a Kiln, then processing the Ender Slag in a Cauldron.

This may require a trip to The End...

betterquesting.name: Obsidian
betterquesting.desc:
Obsidian can be obtained through two methods:

1. A Pickaxe upgraded with a Diamond can mine it in the world.

2. Mixing Water and Lava in a Smeltery will produce Molten Obsidian.  This can then be poured into a Casting Basin to solidify into a full block.

Once obtained, Obsidian can be used to create a portal to the Nether.

betterquesting.name: Sharpening Kit
betterquesting.desc:
A sharpening kit allows you to quickly upgrade a pickaxe without having to create a completely new tool.  Cast metal into a sharpening kit mold, then combine it with your tool and a piece of flint in the tool station.

You'll need an obsidian level pickaxe to mine diamond ore.

betterquesting.name: Blast Furnace
betterquesting.desc:
With access to Hellfire and Nether Brick, it's now possible to make a crude Blast Furnace.  This will allow you to make Steel from Iron and Charcoal.

Arrange Blast Bricks in a 3x3x3 pattern, and right click any face with an Engineer's Hammer.

Automation is not yet possible, but an Improved Blast Furnace may offer such functionality.

betterquesting.name: Mining Levels
betterquesting.desc:
§nInformational Quest§r

Various tiers of tools exist in this world.  They can be constructed using a Tinkers Smeltery or Tool Station, once the required materials are available.

[0] §cWood§r, §7Stone§r
[1] §8Flint§r/§2Cactus§r/§eBone§r - Can mine stone
[2] §7Iron§r - Can mine iron, gold, diamond
[3] §7Iron§r §3(+diamond)§r - Can mine obsidian, emerald
[4] §9Steel§r - Can mine ardite, cobalt
[5] §cArdite§r/§9Cobalt§r/§dManyullyn§r
[6] §5Soul Forged Steel§r

When a metal tier is required to mine itself, there will be an alternate way to gather that material.  The quest book will elaborate in these cases.

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Shiny Rocks
betterquesting.desc:
With the ability to mine Diamonds, it's now possible to upgrade your Iron Pickaxe a step further.  This will allow you to directly mine Emeralds and Obsidian.

To do so, simply place your Pickaxe in a Tool Station with a Diamond to upgrade it.

§7§oThey're minerals§r

betterquesting.name: Industrial Revolution
betterquesting.desc: The industrial age is the time for automation and efficiency.  No longer will you need to work your hands to the bone.  It's time to make the world work for you, rather than you for it.

betterquesting.name: Excavator
betterquesting.desc:
The Excavator is the ultimate way to access limitless resources.  It will require an immense amount of power and supplies to contruct however.

The Excavator is able to mine ores that regular digging cannot find.  While they're not infinite, certain chunks appear to contain large samples of ores.  These chunks can be detected using the Core Sample Drill.

As these machines can run for some time, it may be worth setting up some proper infrastructure to sustain the process.

The Radiators needed to build this structure will require Soulforged Steel however.

betterquesting.name: Leather Retrieval
betterquesting.desc:
Leather is an important requirement for creating armor and machines.  Raw Leather can be obtained from killing Cows or Horses.

Its raw state is not very useful however.  Surely you can refine it further?

betterquesting.name: Going with the Flow
betterquesting.desc:
What is automation without the ability to move items around your world?

With no way to construct item ducts, you've come up with the idea of using Conveyor Belts to ferry items around instead.

Variants on the Conveyor Belt exist for splitting items, dropping them into inventories, or moving them up vertical faces.

betterquesting.name: Transmitting Energy
betterquesting.desc:
Rather than placing long stretches of cable individually, Wire Coils let us hang wires between multiple points.

Machines can accept wires through Connectors, while Relays act to repeat connections over longer distances.

Connectors, Relays, and Wire Coils can be upgraded into higher voltages to reduce power loss over distance.  Certain machines will also require higher voltages to function.

betterquesting.name: Creating Energy
betterquesting.desc:
§nInformational Quest§r

Energy is a fundamental requirement for any sort of automation.  You'll need to find ways to produce, transfer, and store it.

There are numerous options for producing electrical energy:

§oWindmills§r work great at higher altitudes.  These windmills even work well in the rain.  They must be placed on a kinetic dynamo to transfer their energy.

§oWater Mills§r are another option.  Harnessing the gravitational energy from a water fall, they also transfer their power through kinetic dynamo.

§oThermoelectric Generators§r are a third option.  These generators work by converting heat from the temperature difference of two fluids into electrical energy.

§oLightning Rods§r offer an extreme method for generating energy.  They require a large multiblock structure with a tower of steel fences to increase the chance of generating strikes.

§oDiesel Generators§r provide an industrialized method for generating energy.  They output large amounts of power which may be necessary for late-game machines, but require infrastructure to be kept running continously with diesel or biodiesel.  Soulforged Steel is necessary in their construction.

This task can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Arc Furnace
betterquesting.desc:
The Arc Furance is a complex multiblock that allows you to quickly smelt ores and recycle tools and armor.  It's ideal for creating Steel or other alloys.

Use of the Arc Furnace requires Graphite Electodes.  These can be crafted either from a Metal Press, or in the Engineer's Workbench with the appropriate blueprint.

betterquesting.name: Improved Blast Furnace
betterquesting.desc:
The Improved Blast Furnace has a number of improvements over its predecessor.  It allows for complete automation, and will automatically output Steel and slag to nearby inventories or Conveyors.

The Improved Blast Furnace is also able to use Blast Furnace Preheaters, which use electrical power to increase the speed of each operation.

Assemble Improved Blast Bricks in a 3x3x3 with a Hopper on top, and right click any face with the Engineer's Hammer.

betterquesting.name: Squeezer
betterquesting.desc:
The Squeezer is a multiblock structure that allows you to produce Plant Oil.  This is a necessary component for Biodiesel.

The Squeezer is also necessary for producing HOP Graphite, used in the Arc Furnace.

§7§oI hardly knew 'er.§r

betterquesting.name: Fermenter
betterquesting.desc: The Fermenter is a multiblock structure that allows you to produce Ethanol.  This is a necessary component for Biodiesel.

betterquesting.name: Automated Farming
betterquesting.desc:
As great as farming is, sometimes it would be nice to take a break from checking your crops.  The Farming Tool allows just that.

A farming cart works by tilling any Dirt adjacent to the track, and planting Seeds from its inventory.  It will also automatically harvest fully grown crops, and store those in any added chests to be dropped off later.

§7Note: Any combination of Hull, Engine, and Farmer will complete this quest.§r

betterquesting.name: Finding Ores
betterquesting.desc:
§nInformational Quest§r

Caves are now more volatile, and resources more difficult to find.

Many ores are distributed in large veins across the world.  You may need to explore far to find them, but once located you can mine large quantities at once.

§nOres§r
§8Coal§r - Small frequent clusters found anywhere.
§7Iron§r - Medium infrequent clusters found anywhere.
§6Gold§r - Large sparse veins found deep down/in rivers.
§4Redstone§r - Large tendrils often found in deserts.
§1Lapis§r - Small frequent clusters often found in oceans.
§aEmerald§r - Single infrequent ores often found in hills.
§cCopper§r - Large infrequent veins found higher up.
§4Bauxite§r - Large infrequent veins found higher up.
§8Lead§r - Large infrequent veins found deep down.
§9Silver§r - Large infrequent veins found deep down.
§eNickel§r - Large infrequent veins found deep down.
§8Nitre§r - Single infrequent ores found anywhere.

Ores have varying densities, and can often be mined multiple times to extract additional ore.  Mining can cause nearby stone to fracture however, and cobblestone will be affected by gravity.  Falling rocks can be harmful, so be careful when digging upwards.  Fences can be used as supports in a pinch.

While it's possible to branch mine for ores, cave-ins and sparse ore veins make this process more tedious than it's worth.  Instead, rapidly moving through caves is the most effective way of finding large ore lodes.  Often times a single ore may lead to dozens more, if you look hard enough.

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Charcoal Filter
betterquesting.desc: Charcoal can now be used to purify the water.  Craft a Charcoal Filter, and mix it with your Dirty Water to create Filtered Water.

betterquesting.name: Blast Mining
betterquesting.desc:
Blast mining is an effective way of clearing large amounts of rock at once.  Explosives are crafted from Blasting Oil, which in turn is crafted from Gunpowder.  Gunpowder can be made with any source of Saltpeter, Sufur, and Charcoal.

Mining Charges create small, controlled explosives.  They're perfect for clearing straight tunnels or mine shafts.  They are directional, so make note of their orientation before lighting them.

Gunpowder Barrels are used to create a larger blast radius, with little regard for environmental impact.

Unlike standard TNT, Mining Charges and Gunpowder Barrels return 100％ of drops.  However they will only drop one ore piece from dense ores, so do be careful around larger ore veins.

Special consideration should be taken around redstone.  Early tests show it to be §oextremely volatile§r in both its raw and refined forms.

betterquesting.name: Introduction
betterquesting.desc:
Welcome to Homestead!

This Quest Log will act as a tutorial to take you through the revamped tech tree, and explain modified game mechanics.  If you prefer, you can toss this book away and never look at it.  You won't miss any real rewards.  However, it can be very helpful in getting to grips with this new world; particularly for first-time players.

To access the questing menu at any time, you can open this Quest Log, or simply press the tilde (`) key on your keyboard.

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Simple Storage
betterquesting.desc:
Different variants of chests are available for early storage.

The traditional wood Chest is of course always an option.  Different colors of Wood can be used to match your color scheme.  A label can also be added to help improve organization.

A number of immersive storage options also exist, such as the Shelf, Bookshelf, Chest, and Cupboard.

betterquesting.name: Combat
betterquesting.desc:
As this world can be dangerous, you will need to be proactive in keeping yourself protected.

When starting off, you can pick up and throw Rocks to damage mobs.  Rocks can also be used to craft Arrows, and Hemp Fiber to make a bow.

Leather armor can be constructed once tanning is available.  Combined with Iron Ingots, Leather can also be upgraded into Hardened Leather.

betterquesting.name: Buying and Selling
betterquesting.desc:
You can not only eat your produce, but sell it too.  The Shipping Bin allows you to sell produce in bulk for emeralds.

Similarly, the Market allows you to buy various species of saplings with emeralds.  These can be used to acquire fruit Saplings for more complex meals.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Combat
betterquesting.desc:
A Composite Bow and Broadhead Arrows can be used to upgrade your bow.  These arrows will pierce further, and thus do more damage.

Broadhead Arrows can be crafted by sharpening Iron Ingots with a Knife, and must use Treated Wood Sticks for the shaft.

Metal armors must be forged on a Steel Anvil, which is attainable once you've create a Blast Furnace.

betterquesting.name: Watering Cans
betterquesting.desc:
A Watering Can is an ideal way to speed up crop growth.  Available in four materials, they each have different advantages.

§7Stone§r - Cheap to make, but only stores half a tank.
§fIron§r - Jack of all trades but master of none.
§6Gold§r - Faster hydration (1.5x), but can only be filled once.
§5Obsidian§r - Heavier to use, but offers 5x5 reach.

A bucket of Growth Solution will speed up crop growth even further.  This can be crafted with a Water Bucket and Bone Meal.

§7Note: Any Watering Can will activate this quest.§r

betterquesting.name: Reaching New Heights
betterquesting.desc:
As rapid traversal is now so important in finding large deposits underground, investing in tools to help navigate vertical spaces may be advantageous.

Stepladders can be quickly deployed and picked up for climbing short gaps, while Climbing Ropes allow you to create more permanent routes up steep inclines.

betterquesting.name: Day/Night Cycle
betterquesting.desc:
§nInformational Quest§r

The day/night cycle has been modified in this pack.  Nights are shorter, but are also more dangerous.

The light level at night is based on the phase of the moon.  Full moons will be brighter, whilst new moons will be pitch black.

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Making Fire
betterquesting.desc:
Campfires are your first step in creating light.  They can be crafted with Rocks and Logs, and lit by using Sticks on them.  They may take a considerable number of attempts to light.  A Flint and Steel can later be used more reliably.

Torches can be lit by using a Stick on a burning Campfire.  Placed Torches will burn out after one hour, so upgrading to more permanent sources of light such as Lanterns should be an early priority.

A Matchbox, or another Torch can also be used to relight any Torches that go out.

betterquesting.name: Wolves
betterquesting.desc:
A wolf can be a faithful companion.  Though at times they are a bit... dull.  Few other creatures will gleefully walk into a cactus.

Thankfully wolves too can be domesticated.  Giving a tamed wolf a Dog Treat should be enough to teach them new tricks.  These new, Sophisticated Wolves will know how to growl at nearby creepers, avoid friendly fire, and teleport away when drowning.

Dog treats can also be used for breeding sophisticated wolves.  Zombie flesh just isn't high brow enough for these pups.

Armor can be added to help keep your wolves alive, and a chest can be added to offer you additional mobile storage.

Finally, a Name Tag helps differentiate between each faithful companion.

betterquesting.name: Nomadic Lifestyle
betterquesting.desc:
When traveling long distances, it's always nice to have a roof over your head.  Surely only a mad man would plonk down a sleeping bag while monsters roam around them.

Enter the Yurt.  This handy tent offers a quick escape in the night, yet still offers the comforts of home.

To construct a yurt (or similar tent), you'll need to assemble the ingredients in a crafting table.  Be careful not to Shift-Click the item in its final step, due to technical reasons.

Once crafted and placed, a mallet may be used to assemble this portable home.  Assemble each piece to finish the structure.  Finally, right click on the door with your fist to enter inside.

Once you've finished inside, you can exit again and right click the door with your mallet to pick it up again.

For faster future-deployment, consider upgrading to the Super Mallet as soon as possible.  This will allow you to construct the tent in just a single swing.

Craft a Yurt, Tepee, or Bedouin to get started.

betterquesting.name: Gliding in Style
betterquesting.desc:
The hang glider is a fast and effective way of covering large swaths of land at once.

However, it does need to be repaired from time to time.  The more damaged your glider is, the more susceptible it is to getting blown around in storms.  It can be patched up in an anvil with leather.

Booster Rockets are an effective, if not dangerous method of launching yourself in the air.  Right click to propel forward, or shift+right click to propel upwards.

betterquesting.name: Grappling
betterquesting.desc:
There's traveling, and then there's traveling in style.  The grappling hook allows you to gain distance vertically in the blink of an eye.

Reel yourself in, or fling wildly and hope for the best.  The grappling hook is a formidable tool in any situation.

betterquesting.name: On Track
betterquesting.desc: Once you have a source of iron, Rails become an easy way of moving around quickly.  They require little material, and are effective for traversing large areas.

betterquesting.name: Storage on the Go
betterquesting.desc:
Wearable Backpacks are crafted with Leather and allow you to carry additional items on your back.  They provide a small amount of armor protection.

Backpacks must be placed on the ground to be accessed, so in practice you can only use one bag at a time.  Friends however will be able to view your backpack's contents while equipped, so be mindful of who you turn your back to.

To equip a backpack, crouch while breaking it on the ground to equip in your chest slot.

Backpacks can be transformed into Portable Bags with use of an Ender Pearl.  Bags are advantageous in that you are able to hold multiple different bags at a time; however they are smaller as a result.

A plain leather (brown) bag must be crafted first, which can then be upgraded or dyed.

Bags offer two modes: default and pickup.  Pickup mode will automatically suck up any items you collect, which is very useful for mining.  Shift+Right Click the bag to toggle modes.

Void and Ender Bag variants also exist.  They will discard items or move them to your Ender Chest, respectively.

betterquesting.name: Getting Water
betterquesting.desc:
With your Bottle you're now able to collect sea water.  Unless things are absolutely dire you should not drink this directly, as it will lead to dehydration.  This drains your hunger faster, and in turn your nutrition.

Instead move on to the next step to purify the water.

betterquesting.name: Drink Responsibly
betterquesting.desc:
Finally, place the Filtered Water Bottle in a furnace to boil away the impurities.  This water will now be safe to drink.

In the future, a Rain Collector may also be a good option for passively collecting water.

betterquesting.name: Juices
betterquesting.desc:
As thankful as you might be for drinkable water, you're ready for some new variety.  Juices will restore additional thirst, and satisfy your sweet tooth as well.

§7Note: Not all mod drinks will work.  Only those added by Tough as Nails are supported.§r

betterquesting.name: Seasons
betterquesting.desc:
As you progress you will start to notice the seasons changing.  Though their changes are mostly visual, farmers need to be vigilant during Winter months.  Crops will wither away and die if not taken care of, and water will begin to freeze.

A Heating Coil can be used to maintain your crops through Winter.  It must be powered by redstone to function.

A Season Clock or Season Sensor can be used to detect the current time of year.

betterquesting.name: The Atlas
betterquesting.desc:
With all this travelling, it's easy to lose your place.  The Bibliocraft Atlas is the solution.

The Atlas works like an extremely powerful map.  Unlike with vanilla maps, you don't need to constantly switch between different map items to try and find your place.  The Atlas stores all your maps in one item.  It uses Blank Maps to chart new areas.

The Atlas has two settings: Auto-Centering will always update the selected map to your current location, and Auto-Create will consume Blank Maps to map new areas as you walk around.

If Auto-Centering is disabled, you can select the active map using the middle mouse button.  This will also show map boundaries as colored lines in the map inventory.

The Atlas supports waypoints to mark unique locations.  If you add a Waypoint Compass to your Atlas, you can then link it with a Waypoint to always point in the appropriate direction.

Map Frames can be used to create immersive map walls.  Sneak+Right Click a Map Frame to copy the selected map piece over.

Finally, the Atlas can be upgraded with the Eternal Compass enchantment.  This grants a special compass upon your death that always points to your body.

For normal use, the atlas can be put into your offhand to reduce the amount of screen space it takes up.

betterquesting.name: Animal Husbandry
betterquesting.desc:
§nInformational Quest§r

Animals are an essential part of any farm.  Finding and domesticating them will allow you to create Milk, Eggs, and other resources.

Of course, taking care of animals isn't as simple as throwing them in a pit.  Animals require food, water, and an appropriate environment.  An unhappy animal won't breed or produce many resources, so meeting their needs is important.

Animals can be fed and and watered using troughs.  Troughs can hold Water, Wheat, or Slop.  They can also be automated using Droppers, and will output a redstone signal through a Comparator.

Animals can also be fed by hand using their favorite food, and they will drink from any nearby ponds.

Gender matters here, so be sure to bring back both a male and female if you plan to start a farm.

Different animal types can be found in different biomes.  Try searching all around the world to find new breeds!

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Cows
betterquesting.desc:
Cows are the cornerstone of any farm.  They provide ample amounts of Beef, as well as Milk for cream and cheeses.

Different breeds of cows can be found in the world.  Some breeds, like Holstein and Friesian cows, are highly valued for their Milk and Leather.  Similarly, Hereford, Longhorn and Angus cows are prized for the quality of their Beef.  These breeds provide much more nourishing meals.

Cows can be fed by hand or through troughs.  Their favorite foods are Wheat, Dandelions, and Poppies.

Cows will drink from troughs or from a pond directly.

betterquesting.name: Pigs
betterquesting.desc:
If you're looking for a rich source of meat, pigs are an excellent choice.  Some species are ideal for Roasts, while others can be turned into delicious crispy Bacon.  What's not to love about pigs?

Pigs are happiest when rolling around in the Mud or swimming in water.  Mud can be easily crafted with Dirt and Water.  Be sure to keep your §mdinner§r piggies happy to maximize yields.

Pigs have one ability that no other animals have: they are able to dig up truffles hidden inside forest biomes.  Truffles are used in a variety of high-saturation meals, and so it may be worth staying their execution for now.

A pigs favorite food is Slop or Carrots.  Buckets of Slop can be crafted from Milk and Vegetables, and thrown into a trough to keep your pigs fed.

betterquesting.name: Chickens
betterquesting.desc:
Chickens are not only adorable, but also a source of meat and eggs.

For a Hen to lay eggs, it must have a Nest to roost in.  If kept happy, the hen will begin to lay eggs which can then be collected.

If a Rooster is also nearby, the laid egg may be fertilized and the egg will hatch new chicks.  Be mindful of this when considering putting a rooster and hen together.

Chickens require both water and seeds to stay happy.  They'll drink smaller amounts of water from troughs than cows, and will eat seeds that have been placed on the ground by right clicking.

Certain species of chickens may produce brown eggs, while others are renowned for their meat.

betterquesting.name: Fluid Dynamics
betterquesting.desc:
While moving items was useful, you also need a way to pipe fluids around your world.  Fluid Pipes allow you to do just that.

Fluid Pipes will automatically connect to neighboring Pipes and fluid containers.  Connected Pipes can be separated by using an Engineer's Hammer between them.

While some machines will automatically export fluids, sometimes a Pump is needed as well.

Pumps require both electric power and a redstone signal to operate.  Connect a power source to the top, and redstone to any side.

Pumps will automatically input from the bottom.  They works with fluid source blocks in the world, or fluid containers.

The sides can also be configured with an Engineer's Hammer as input (blue) or output (orange).  This is needed to direct the fluid after pumping it.

betterquesting.name: Bridging the Gap
betterquesting.desc:
If you've ever needed to cross a large chasm with some frequency, what better way than a rickety rope bridge?  The Bridge Building Gun offers the perfect solution in deploying a bridge quickly to cross almost any gap.

Similarly, the Ladder Gun is its vertical counterpart.  Shoot where you want to go, then start climbing.

Both guns use Wooden Slabs and Rope as ammunition.  The slabs can be any of the six vanilla colors.

betterquesting.name: Storing Energy
betterquesting.desc:
Unlike mechanical power, you're able to harness this new potential energy as electricity.  This electric energy is much more flexible, allowing it to be transferred easily and stored in capacitors.

Capacitors can be upgraded, and are useful for keeping large buffers or smoothing the power input to a machine.

betterquesting.name: Refinery
betterquesting.desc:
The Refinery converts Seed Oil and Ethanol into Biodiesel.  This can be used in a Diesel Generator.

As Biodiesel is completely renewable, this can be scaled up to large quantities of power.

betterquesting.name: Coke Oven
betterquesting.desc:
The Coke Oven allows us an easier method of producing Charcoal and Creosote Oil.  It also allows us to convert regular Coal into a more efficient form of fuel called Coal Coke.

Creosote is used to create Treated Wood, which is used in many industrial recipes.

Arrange coke bricks in a 3x3x3 pattern, and right click any face with an Engineer's Hammer.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Flint Hatchet
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Power Ready
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Leather
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Quenching Your Thirst
betterquesting.desc:
Eventually you will get thirsty.  Water cannot be safely drank from the sea.  Instead you must capture it in a Bottle, then purify it before it is safe.

Start by crafting a Glass Bottle.  This can be made from Glass, or by using Sand directly on a Campfire.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Animal Husbandry Read
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Growing Crops...
betterquesting.desc:
Farming will be an essential skill in keeping yourself and your animals healthy.  A Mattock of any material will be required to start tilling the lands to plant crops.

When you're ready to plant, there will be many crop variants to choose from.  Crop Seeds can be found by punching Tall Grass, trading with Villagers, ransacking existing farms, or inviting a Farmer NPC to your town.

Crops won't grow over night.  In fact they can take many days and a lot of sunshine to grow, so you should plan ahead.

Once a crop is ready, you can break it with a Left Click to get many seeds back.  Alternatively you can harvest it in place with a Right Click to get more produce, but fewer seeds.

If you're not expanding your farm, a gentler touch may be the way to go.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Nether
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Kitchen Construction
betterquesting.desc:
The various Kitchen blocks will make it much easier to manage your cooking tools and foods.

The Cooking Table allows you to easily select the recipe you'd like to cook.  It will examine all food stores in connected inventories to show you available options.

The Oven allows you to cook food in batch.  It requires a source of fuel such as Coal or Cooking Oil.

The Sink is an easy source of water.  It allows you to quickly fill buckets, and enables the Cooking Table an automatic source of water for any recipes that require it.

The Tool Rack provides storage for any additional kitchen tools you have.  It enables the Cooking Table to make use of the tools hung on it.

Kitchen Counters and the Fridge provide additional storage for any foods to be made available to the Cooking Table.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Shiny Rocks
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Steel Anvil
betterquesting.desc: The Steel Anvil allows you to produce a new grade of tools, and finally begin smithing metal armors.

betterquesting.name: Up and Down
betterquesting.desc:
Mechanical power isn't just useful for running machines, it can also move §oyou§r.

A Pulley allows you to create a simple elevator.  Start by placing your Pulley and hooking it up to mechanical power.  Then place a Platform two blocks below it - ideally in a 3x3 pattern.  Finally, attach an Anchor to connect the two.

Now when you add Rope to the pulley, it will be able to drop the platform by that amount.  Toggle mechanical power to raise and lower the platform.

§7Note: Gearboxes will accept a redstone signal to stop transferring their power.§r

betterquesting.name: Mobile Automation
betterquesting.desc:
Minecarts are an effective way of traveling far distances.  What if you were to augment them?

This simple idea has revealed a number of ways to automate the world around you.  Farming crops, chopping trees, even mining could be automated given the right combination of parts.

Surely you'd need at least a Hull, primary Tool, and an Engine for each cart.  Storage may be useful as well.

First you'll need a way to assemble them.  A Cart Assembler provided with a small amount of fuel should do the trick.  Then you'll need to lay some Rail for the cart to follow.

betterquesting.name: Automated Logging
betterquesting.desc:
Wood Cutting carts are extremely effective at creating magnificent forests, and then dutifully chopping them down again.

They work by placing any saplings from their inventory beside the track, every second block.  If a cart comes to a fully grown tree, it will fell it and store its contents in any added chests.

Unlike with traditional axes, a Wood Cutter will be able to chop trees cleanly without spewing wood and leaves everywhere.

A Coal Engine is recommended for this cart, as trees will block out the sun.

§7Note: Any combination of Hull, Engine, and Wood Cutter with complete this quest.§r

betterquesting.name: Automated Mining
betterquesting.desc:
It seems even mining can be automated now.  With the use of a Drill, your carts are able to dig their way through mountains or the underground.

A number of addons will make this endeavor more fruitful:

- A Railer will enable your cart to build Rail in front of it, allowing it to sustain its own path.  The Larger Railer stores 6 slots in of 3.
- A Bridge Builder allows your cart to cross gaps by placing blocks.  Only a few blocks are accepted: Stone, Stone Bricks, Wooden Planks, and Bricks.
- The Height Controller lets you specify the height that the cart will try to mine at.
- The Torch Placer ensures your caves stay lit, to prevent monster spawns.

§7Note: Any combination of Hull, Engine, and Drill will complete this quest.§r

betterquesting.name: Cooking Tools
betterquesting.desc:
To cook gourmet meals, you're going to need the right tools for the job.  Crafting the various cookware will expand your kitchen repertoire, and enable you to create more nourishing meals.

Of course, you'll need a place to keep all these tools...

betterquesting.name: Diesel Generator
betterquesting.desc:
The Diesel Generator is one of the most powerful generators of electric power.

By burning Diesel or Biodiesel, this generator can be completely automated.  This makes it attractive for powering farms and other utilities.

The Radiators needed to build this structure will require Soulforged Steel however.

betterquesting.name: Fairy Lights
betterquesting.desc:
Fairy Lights allow us to hang strings of lights between two points.  These lights can be customized using a variety of patterns and effects.

Start by crafting the light you want to hang.  These come in many varieties, from paper lanterns, to flowers, to other assorted shapes.

Use a Stick or String in the recipe to decide if the string should be straight or have slack.

Finally, you can add glowstone to add a twinkle effect to any light.

Decorative Tinsel is also available, and Letter Bunting which allows you to display messages across your string.

§7Note: Any hanging light will activate this quest.§r

betterquesting.name: Villager Box
betterquesting.desc:
Occasionally you will find an Invitation in dungeon loot.  These can be sent out in a Mailbox to invite new villagers to move into your area.

Not long after sending out your invite, you are likely to receive Mail from an interested villager.  You can then accept their request to move in, and find a home for them.

Once they have a home, villagers can be traded with, and even upgraded into different professions.  This may allow you to trade unique items, or spend the coins that monsters drop.

betterquesting.name: Discovery
betterquesting.desc:
When you held that piece of Aquamarine, you felt its latent energy pass over you.  Perhaps there's more here than meets the eye?

Pulling open a book to jot down some notes, you find it reacts noticeably with the Aquamarine.

betterquesting.name: Discount Hoppers
betterquesting.desc:
The Wooden Hopper may be considered a downgrade to the traditional metal Hopper, but its affordable cost makes it perfect for early-game automation.

§7§oThese hoppers are so cheap, I must be hopping mad.§r

betterquesting.name: Distributor
betterquesting.desc:
The Distributor allows you to split items evenly into four different directions.  This is useful for splitting item inputs into different machines, or paralellizing certain tasks.

They combine especially well with conveyor belts for this purpose.

betterquesting.name: Communication Breakdown
betterquesting.desc:
Block Signals are used for regulating the flow of Minecarts.  They will output a redstone signal by detecting if a cart is on a length of track behind them.  This can be used in conjunction with Booster Rails to start and stop Minecarts and to prevent jams.

A length of track is defined as any stretch between two signals, so you'll need at least two Signals to create a working system.

Holding a Rail Configurator while holding Crouch will show you the layout of your network.

betterquesting.name: Routing
betterquesting.desc:
It's also possible to create a powerful routing system using Station Markers.  This enables you to set destinations on your carts, and Block Signals will attempt to intelligently route your cart towards that Station.

You can Right Click on Stations to set their name.  Then, use the Rail Configurator tool to set a destination on a cart.  It must match the Station name exactly.

Place Block Signals in front of any forks to allow them to change their direction.  Regular signaling rules will still apply.

The Rail Network Controller allows you to see an overview of your entire network, and all carts moving within it.  The display will be dark until a valid network has been created.

betterquesting.name: Cart Loader
betterquesting.desc:
The Cart Loader is a special hopper that holds carts while loading them.

Combined with signaling, this allows you to create fully autonomous loading and unloading zones.

betterquesting.name: Chisels and Bits
betterquesting.desc:
The Chisel allows you to build with blocks at a much finer scale.

Start by crafting a C&B Chisel of any quality.  With the Chisel equipped you can Left Click on any building block to start chipping away at it.  Doing so creates Bits, which are tiny fragments from that block.

Bits can now be placed either back into the original block, or into a new blockspace to start creating something new.  You can combine Bits from many different materials to create elaborately detailed structures.

As these Bits can fill your inventory rather quickly, the Bit Bag is the perfect solution to avoid being overrun.  It will automatically collect excess bits, while leaving you with one stack to build with.

Note that many tools in Chisels and Bits offer a context menu when Alt is held.  This lets you select different chiseling and placing modes, for instance.

betterquesting.name: Fancy Blocks
betterquesting.desc:
WallpaperCraft offers many unique designs and colors to work with.

To get started, craft a Blank Pattern Press.  This is the template for the different patterns you can impress on colored blocks.

There's a variety of available templates including Stripes, Brick, Floral, and Wool.

Next, craft your favorite color of Solid Colored Blocks.  These are crafted with 9 Hardened Clay in a crafting grid.  The 8 base colors you can craft with are: Blue, Gray, Yellow, Brown, Green, Purple, Red, and Cyan.  Each color then has 15 additional shades available.

To cycle through the different shades of each color, you can either craft the block by itself, or hold Crouch and scroll with your mouse.

Any block can then have a pattern imprinted on it by simply crafting them together.  This allows for a large combination of colors and shapes to decorate with.

betterquesting.name: Proper Ventilation
betterquesting.desc:
While perhaps not crucial for function, the Chimney block is absolutely essential for style.  It dutifully pipes smoke upwards out of your home, both to improve air quality and to produce pretty particles effects.

Chimneys can be used with most burning blocks, such as the furnace, campfire, or any apparatus placed over a regular fire (eg. cauldron, crucible).

betterquesting.name: Charcoal Pit
betterquesting.desc:
The Charcoal Pit is a method of converting wooden logs into Charcoal.  By removing all oxygen and burning the wood slowly, it can become fully carbonized.  As a fuel source it will be able to reach much higher temperatures.

The pit itself is a shapeless multiblock structure.  It's formed by burying Log Piles (crafted from 9 logs) into any contiguous shape, and then covering it with a solid block such as dirt.

Charcoal Pits must be lit with fire, and then immediately covered up.  Allowing oxygen to enter runs the risk of burning away all of your logs.

Once started, the Charcoal Pit will take approximately 15 minutes to complete.  Smoke particles will billow out the top while it's working.  Once they've stopped it will be safe to dig up the Charcoal Piles below.

A Fire Charge is an early method for producing fire.  It can be crafted with Niter from a Creeper, or Saltpeter found underground.

betterquesting.name: Architectural Design
betterquesting.desc:
The Sawbench is an extremely useful tool for cutting blocks in complex shapes.  This can be used for creating roofs, railings, and many other designs.

To begin, place the Sawbench and insert any decorative block.  A menu will allow you to choose the template for your shape.  Simply pull the new architectural block out to see your shape take form.

When placing cut blocks, pay attention to the side of the block that you're placing it on.  This will determine its rotation and position, if applicable.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Really Time to Mine
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Sheep
betterquesting.desc:
For the most part, Sheep remain the faithful old fluffballs you've always known.  Their wool can be harvested with shears, and they'll provide mutton upon death.

Wool can be sheared automatically via Dispenser.  It also has many uses in various crafting recipes.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Storage
betterquesting.desc:
A number of options also exist for more advanced storage.

Iron Chests offer a large increase in storage capacity, for a price.

Storage Crates will continue to hold your items when destroyed.  Useful for moving large numbers of items, although they require Creosote Oil to craft.

Silos from Immersive Engineering offer very large storage of a single item type.  They require a multiblock structure, as described in the Engineer's Manual.

Finally, Ingots can be stacked directly on the ground to show off your wealth.  Very opulent.

betterquesting.name: You feel a stroke of inspiration...
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Shrines
betterquesting.desc:
The Journal appears cryptic, and full of random glowing dots.  Still, you feel yourself being pulled in.

Moving closer to the pages, you start to notice recognizable shapes.  A crystal, a wand?

The icons are linked by lines which almost seem to be flexing.  Perhaps this indicates the order in which you should examine these objects further.

The journal speaks of two types of Shrine.  Breaking into one of the larger shrines seems like the best place to start your journey.

What does the Journal mean by "placing a crafting table near the crystal", though?

§7Note: Zoom with your Mouse's Scroll Wheel.§r

betterquesting.name: Sorting Storage
betterquesting.desc:
As the number of items in your storage begins to mount, you admit that some organization would go a long way.

When combined with a Filtered Hopper and some Redstone, chests seem to become much smarter.  They allow you to filter by mod name, certain presets, or existing inventory.

These chests also seem able to create a network.  By placing them next to each other, they will sort items automatically into neighboring chests.  Very useful!

§7§oBlicks and blocks§r

betterquesting.name: Something Weird
betterquesting.desc:
While automating the world around you has proven effective in saving time and effort, you find that things will often stop working when you wander off too far.  §oSpooky!§r

Whatever the cause of this is, the Weirding Gadget is your solution.  By spinning its top, it ensures that your machines will continue to work even while you're away.

In technical terms this device is known as a "chunk loader".  It will continue to load a 3x3 chunk radius until 7 days after you leave the server.  If you're unable to return, anybody may also Right Click the device to spin it up again.

Pressing F3+G will show you the chunk boundaries, to determine the affected area.

betterquesting.name: Home Decoration
betterquesting.desc:
While fancy shapes and colored walls are all well and good, sometimes you just need some classic furniture.

Make your home cozier with a Sofa and Coffee Table.  Then add some lighting with a Switch and Ceiling Fan.

The Sofa can be extended by placing blocks adjacent to each other, and colored with dye.

If you've met a furniture seller, you can always buy directly from them.

betterquesting.name: Trigger: Tool Creation
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Nutrition
betterquesting.desc:
Nutrition plays an important role in your overall health.  Increasing your nutrition will allow you to take more hits, and improve your own strength and dexterity.

Lacking in a balanced diet however will lead to malnourishment; this will impede your ability to mine and defend effectively.

A small number of nutrition points will be lost when you hunger, and a larger number will be lost if you die.

The five nutrients available are: Dairy, Fruit, Grain, Protein, and Veggie.  Eating different foods will increase one or more of these nutrients, so variation in diet is important.

You can access your current nutrition from the player inventory, or by pressing the 'N' key.

This quest can be completed simply by checking it off.

betterquesting.name: Resonating Wand
betterquesting.desc:
Another item described by the Journal is the Resonating Wand.  It's a peculiar device, and one that appears to vibrate softly when held.

It almost seems to be reaching out to the stars themselves.

betterquesting.name: Rock Crystal Ore
betterquesting.desc: The Journal describes Rock Crystals as being found deep, deep underground.  How are you to find them?

betterquesting.name: Luminous Crafting Table
betterquesting.desc:
As useful as this new crafting light is, you'd like to be able to harness this ability elsewhere.  The book suggests there's an upgraded version which can be crafted in this altar: the Luminous Crafting Table.

This new crafting table operates directly on starlight, and needs to be placed in a location with a lot of it.  Not all locations react well, but you notice higher elevations seem to yield more starlight.

betterquesting.name: Constellation Paper
betterquesting.desc:
In the chests located in and around these Shrines, you've found small scraps of paper known as Constellation Paper.  Each parchment seems to describe the positions and movements of stars.

Surely these will be useful later.  For now, they can be stored inside your Journal by Shift+Right Clicking it and placing the Papers inside.

betterquesting.name: Hand Telescope
betterquesting.desc:
The Hand Telescope can be crafted with the new Luminous Crafting Table.  It allows you to gaze at stars in their glorious incandescence, and to find the constellations you've previously learned about.

Constellations will show up as a second layer of stars which appear in the telescope's foreground.  Once located, you will be able to sketch out the constellation by holding Shift and drawing between stars to create lines.

Sketch the known constellations to discover them, and add their record to your Journal.

Remember that the moon phase is important, and constellations will not always be visible.

§7Note: Multiple crafting recipes may exist for the Telescope components.  The Luminous Crafting Table recipes should be used for now.§r

betterquesting.name: Exploration...
betterquesting.desc:
The further you delve into the Journal, the more you realize there is to explore.  The secrets to Astral Sorcery seem locked away in its pages.

The Quest Log ends here, but there is much yet to be discovered.

betterquesting.name: Pumpjack
betterquesting.desc:
Pumpjacks are used to pump Crude Oil out of the earth.  This oil is not visible while exploring, but must be detected using a Core Sample Drill instead.

A Pumpjack will continue to pump from an oil chunk until it is fully depleted.  At this point the output will slow down significantly, however a small amount of oil will always be available.

Multiple Pumpjacks may be used in an oil chunk simultaneously, however once a chunk is fully depleted the additional Pumpjacks will stop functioning.

betterquesting.name: Distillation Tower
betterquesting.desc:
The Distillation Tower is used to process Crude Oil into Diesel.

The distilling process requires energy to heat the Crude Oil to different boiling points.  In addition to Diesel, this also creates a byproduct of Bitumen which is ued in creating Asphalt Concrete.

Diesel is a slower burning variant of Biodiesel, and can be burned in a Diesel Generator to produce large amounts of electrical energy.

Due to the size of this structure, it may be ideal to create a pipeline to transport oil from other sources.

betterquesting.name: Core Sample Drill
betterquesting.desc:
Core Sample Drills are small multiblock structures which can sample the current chunk for oil and other materials.  Unlike traditional quaries however, these resources can only be extracted using specialized machines.  They are not visible in the world.

A small amount of power is required for a Core Sample Drill to operate.  Once finished, a drill will return a Core Sample.  This shows the resources available in that chunk, if any.

If minerals are found, an Excavator will be required to dig them up.  If Oil is found, a Pump Jack will be required instead.

betterquesting.name: Stone Age
betterquesting.desc: With new beginnings come new experiences.  Craft basic tools to start on your journey.

betterquesting.name: Farm Life
betterquesting.desc: Living off the land.

betterquesting.name: Mechanical Age
betterquesting.desc: With iron, a new world of possibilities opens up.

betterquesting.name: Industrial Age
betterquesting.desc: And the world was forever changed.

betterquesting.name: Getting Around
betterquesting.desc: Oh, the places you'll go.

betterquesting.name: Automation
betterquesting.desc: Where there's a will, there's a way.

betterquesting.name: Home Life
betterquesting.desc: Putting the Home in Homestead.

betterquesting.name: Starlight
betterquesting.desc: The stars shimmer with energy.
